page.title: 12COMMUNITY CENTRE
page.content:
CREGGAN HALL WAS BUILT BY THE LOCAL GAELIC FOOTBALL CLUB, KICKHAM'S, AND WAS OPENED IN 1982.
AS WELL AS DRESSING ROOMS AND SHOWERS FOR TEAMS PLAYING IN THE ADJOINING FOOTBALL FIELD,THERE ARE COMMITTEE ROOMS, A KITCHEN AND A LARGE OPEN HALL WHICH CAN BE USED FOR A VARIETY OF ACTIVITIES.
IT HAS NOW BECOME THE SOCIAL CENTRE FOR THE AREA AND IS USED FOR YOUNG AND OLD ALIKE.
IT IS USED FOR THE YOUTH CLUB, THE IRISH LANGUAGE AND DANCING CLASSES, ROLLER SKATING AND CEILES, AS WELL AS CONCERTS, PLAYS, BINGO AND FUNCTIONS FOR THE OLD AND DISABLED.
